channel.title: Uid
channel.description: Okay, the tut I did for the UID, I changed it back server side BACK to 0. But the one on my client I set to 16935248 alright. I know this is funny, but I shouldn't be able to connect since the UID's do not match, and it's declared. How do I get the UID to actually work, so only my client will work and no one elses?

item.title: Uid
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

[quote=“Demon6994, post:1, topic:406162”]Okay, the tut I did for the UID, I changed it back server side BACK to 0. But the one on my client I set to 16935248 alright.
I know this is funny, but I shouldn’t be able to connect since the UID’s do not match, and it’s declared. How do I get the UID to actually work, so only my client will work and no one elses?[/quote]

In the login process:

final int expectedUID = yourUid;
final int clientUID = readInt();
if (clientUID != expectedUID) {
    socket.close();
    return;
}

Something similar to that should suffice.
